page.title: 01Danby Dale and Rigg
page.content: This picturesque valley set in the north york moors national park is the site for one of the camphill village trust villages called Botton Village. surrounded by moorland and set between two 370 high ridges at the head of Danby Dale. This isolated community which cares for the mentally handicapped concentrates on a high degree f self sufficiency by varied forms of farming and agriculture and also various craft industries such as weaving, doll making, glass engraving and candle making etc. All the buildings and organic farming methods combine to compliment this beautiful landscape. The population of the village is around 300.
